line_1: The lonely woodcock seeks the splashy glen,
line_2: The snipe and duck enjoy the moorish fen,

line_1: The lonely woodcock seeks the splashy glen,
line_2: Like Eremites they live, and shun the sight of men.

line_1: But the docksy auld laird of the Warlock glen,
line_2: Raised up the latch, and cam' crousely ben.

line_1: To summer moonshine of some fairy glen.
line_2: Compared to thine; — red wildfire of the fen,

line_1: There's bonny Tibby o' the glen,
line_2: Their beauty crazed baith their men,

line_1: " Who houghs the Field, or ditches in the Glen,
line_2: " Perhaps the happiest of the Sons of Men!

line_1: " Who houghs the Field, or ditches in the Glen,
line_2: "Delves in his Garden, or secures his Pen:

line_1: " Who houghs the Field, or ditches in the Glen,
line_2: "He tosses not in Sloth's abhorred Den;

line_1: When first in Roslin's lovely glen
Each wand'ring genius of the lonely glen
line_2: Shall start to view the glittering haunts of men;

line_1: The peaceful cottage — in the glen,
line_2: With trees — around — and crystal well,
